stlib.datatypes.spatial.util

Class Face

  • java.lang.Object
    • stlib.datatypes.spatial.util.Face
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Spatial, FaceIF

    public class Face
extends java.lang.Object
implements FaceIF
    This utility class represents spatial objects of type 'Face'.
    A 'Face' is a polygon which possibly containing some polygonal holes.
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CycleIF boundary
      Outer boundary of this 'Face'
      private boolean defined
      The defined flag, indicates if a data type object is defined
      private java.util.List<CycleIF> holes
      List with holes this 'Face' may contain

      Constructor for a simple 'Face' object without holes.
      Face(java.util.List<PointIF> boundaryPoints)
      Creates a simple 'Face' object without holes by passing a list of points which define the outer boundary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Face

        public Face(CycleIF boundary)
        Constructor for a simple 'Face' object without holes.
        Parameters:
        boundary - - outer boundary of this 'Face'

      • Face

        public Face(java.util.List<PointIF> boundaryPoints)
        Creates a simple 'Face' object without holes by passing a list of points which define the outer boundary. The points of the passed list are connected in the order of their occurrence in the list, whereby the last point of the list is connected with the first.
        Parameters:
        boundaryPoints - - List of points of the boundary

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(CycleIF hole)
        Description copied from interface: FaceIF
        Add a hole to this 'FaceIF'.
        Only defined 'CycleIF' hole objects will be added.
        Specified by:
        add in interface FaceIF
        Parameters:
        hole - - the hole, a 'CycleIF', to add
        Returns:
        true if adding was successful, false otherwise

      • add

        public boolean add(java.util.List<PointIF> holePoints)
        Description copied from interface: FaceIF
        Add a hole to this 'FaceIF' by passing a list of points which define the hole boundary. The points of the passed list are connected in the order of their occurrence in the list, whereby the last point of the list is connected with the first.
        Specified by:
        add in interface FaceIF
        Parameters:
        holePoints - - the hole, List of points of the hole
        Returns:
        true if adding was successful, false otherwise
